title: Ticket #7773: Master is never IsReady if managing non-DC daemons
description:
When non-Daemon-Core daemons are run by the master (e.g., CREDMON_OAUTH), since those non-DC daemons never send a keepalive, so the master perpetually thinks they are in "Startup", which means that condor_who -quick will never show IsReady to be true. Instead you get a who ad that looks like this: 

$ condor_who -quick
CREDD = "Alive"
CREDD_PID = 2624590
CREDMON_OAUTH = "Startup"
CREDMON_OAUTH_PID = 2624596
IsReady = false
MASTER = "Alive"
MASTER_PID = 2624427
NumAlive = 4
NumDaemons = 5
NumDead = 0
NumHold = 0
NumHung = 0
NumStartup = 1
SCHEDD = "Alive"
SCHEDD_PID = 2624579
SHARED_PORT = "Alive"
SHARED_PORT_PID = 2624554

We should either make the non-DC daemons send a keepalive (perhaps using https://htcondor.readthedocs.io/en/latest/apis/python-bindings/api/htcondor.html#htcondor.send_alive), or the master should be able to understand that some daemons will not send keep alives.

Though it hasn't come up yet, this will eventually be a problem for #7501 and #7745 (both use the who ad to determine whether a personal condor has started up correctly).
